alert.note: Alert for Burnett; Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 2:25AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Washburn, northeastern Burnett and northwestern Sawyer Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 225 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Webb Lake Wisconsin, or 12 miles northwest of Spooner, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hayward, Round Lake, Trego, Minong, Webb Lake Wisconsin, Seeley, Little Round Lake, Springbrook, Northwoods Beach, Mckenzie Lake, Grindstone Lake, Birch Island Lake, Lampson, Nelson Lake, Totagatic Flowage, Lac Courte Oreilles, Stanberry, Earl, Chief Lake, and Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters.
